topic.title: SubgraphOS.
topic.body:
Hi all,
has anyone tried SubgraphOS?
It's been under development for a long time and they now have their first release.
I'll try it, but before that I'd like to get an opinion from someone experienced with Linux.
Link: https://subgraph.com/index.en.html

1_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz.body: Kodachi. Because it's the best for anonymity. installed on a hard drive as my main OS, for everyday work. But it's hard not to have a Windows machine available for those software that are available only on Windows. Also, when it comes to printers, they make good software for Windows, on Linux you have to tweak things. And the fact that you can't avoid having to use command lines at one point or another is a big drawback for mainstream adoption. Windows has become a very good OS at the same time it was becoming a very good spyware.
Deepin is the closest Linux distribution you can get to Windows or Mac. This is what I tell people to use when they want to move away from Windows.
